column5: We will be there the last week of June.We'll be fishing out of Flayers. Where are yoy guy's staying? Please leave some walleye's for us. Terry
We will be there the last week of June.We'll be fishing out of Flayers. Where are yoy guy's staying? Please leave some walleye's for us. Terry
Please let me know how the water level is in Ignace, we will be staying at Gummeson's on Mamagweiss and travleing to Indian Lake thru the channels. Thanks, Sturg

I was up two weeks ago, and the water in the Ignace area was about 2 feet below what it was last spring. They have experienced a little more rain but not enough to recover significantly. The fire ban was lifted the weekend I was there. Despite the snow and freezing temps we did well enough on walleye's I am heading out again in a few days for another week and will provide an update when I return. Looking forward to temps above 40 F. for this go around. good luck GF

Guide, I've been checking the LWCB basin data website as well as some real time hydrometric data website and I think you might be pleasantly surprised. That area's inflow and outflow have significantly increased over the last 2 weeks. I'll be up there on Sunday and have hopes of somewhat normal water levels. The thing to note is that the temps for next week are predicted to be pretty high.
Just back from Gummies....water is down but most boats getting through the creek without getting out....smaller boats running the creek...fishing good....
Just back from Gummies....water is down but most boats getting through the creek without getting out....smaller boats running the creek...fishing good....
I hope you are correct, I will see in a few days. Good luck GF
how often have youbeen to Gummies Sturg? My family has gone up there for years.
What is the best way to get to Ignace from Wisconsin?
What is the best way to get to Ignace from Wisconsin?
Go NE out of Duluth to Pigeon River...Then take the short cut around Thunnderbay....then on to Ignace. You can follow me on June 8 if you want!!!
Go NE out of Duluth to Pigeon River...Then take the short cut around Thunnderbay....then on to Ignace. You can follow me on June 8 if you want!!!
You got it !!....that works from Iowa too !!!:exactly:
You got it !!....that works from Iowa too !!!:exactly:

Hartfish is right on the money. I'll be hot on his tail on June 9th from Missouri. BTW - at the Border Crossing, watch out for the bugs if it is dusk. They'll eat you alive when you roll down the window.

pigeon river / grand portage, approx 30 miles after customs take the hwy 130 short cut to avoid Thunder bay and save yourself 45 minutes of driving. By the way the short cut is now Paved, they finished it early last fall. very nice. good luck GF
